alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:02PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Alamance and northwestern Orange Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 102 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Baynes, or near Jericho, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Graham, Mebane, Elon, Gibsonville, Haw River, Carr, Lake Burlington, Lake Cammack Park & Marina and Altamahaw-Ossipee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
